bioghist.p: Katharine McBride (1904-1976) was a 1925 graduate of Bryn Mawr College. She was a researcher in psychology, working with Dr. Theodore Weisenburg. She taught at Bryn Mawr from 1935 to 1940, leaving to become a dean at Radcliffe College. In 1942, she was appointed President of Bryn Mawr College. She remained in this post until 1970. In 1952 she was elected the first woman Trustee of the University of Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: This collection is grouped into six sections. Personal research and correspondence materials include: school records, speeches, notes from McBride's committee activities, and bound typescripts of McBride's "A Psychological Study of Aphasia." President's Office administrative files include: Presidents' Reports, Tri-College Cooperation records, and records from departments within Bryn Mawr. President's Office outgoing correspondence consists of letters sent from McBride's office between 1951 and 1957. Trusteeships and non-Bryn Mawr committee records include: correspondence, reports, minutes, and newsletters from various committees on which McBride served, including the President's Committee on Education Beyond High School, the National Science Foundation, and the Center for Cultural and Technical Interchange Between East and West. Financial records, covering the period 1946-1955, include: budgets, scholarships, and faculty salaries. This section of the collection also includes records on student attendance, honors, and financial aid. Grant materials include documentation of awards and grants to the college and compliance with governmental regulations for the period 1956 to 1970. The McBride collection also includes materials relating to the establishment of the Graduate School of Social Work and Social Research as a separate division of College.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: Alice Gore King scrapbooks and Edie McGrath office files.
